definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: “Foreign critics would look at today’s data and argue for stronger yuan gains,” said Ben Simpfendorfer, a Hong Kong-based economist at Royal Bank of Scotland Plc.
sentences.chinese: 外国评论家看到今天的数据，又会说让人民币升值。

sentences.english: Upward revaluation of currency is sometimes disbenefit to our company.
sentences.chinese: 货币升值有时候对我们的公司没有好处。

sentences.english: Speculators, betting that the yuan will appreciate, are buying it with weakening greenbacks.
sentences.chinese: 打赌人民币升值的投机者用疲软的美元购买人民币。

sentences.english: Rapid appreciation will make Division in the Chinese enterprise group will be more apparent.
sentences.chinese: 快速升值也会令中国企业群的分裂现象会更为明显。

sentences.english: Research Group of RMB Appreciation, School of Finance, Renmin University of China.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民大学财政金融学院人民币升值研究课题组。

sentences.english: Appreciation against a falling dollar leaves the yuan little changed on a trade-weighted basis.
sentences.chinese: 对贬值中的美元升值，贸易加权汇率就没有什么变化。

sentences.english: Ultimately, though, trying to muscle China into revaluing the yuan would be a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 不过说到底，强迫中国使人民币升值终将是一个错误。

sentences.english: More orthodox measures aimed at limiting the franc’s rise have proved ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 旨在限制法郎升值的更加正统的政策被证明是无效的。

sentences.english: The Indian rupee has appreciated about 4 percent against the dollar so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年以来印度卢比兑美元已升值了约4%。

sentences.english: However, that range of appreciation is still too small for Mr Schumer.
sentences.chinese: 不过，对舒默来说，那种升值范围还是太小了。

sentences.english: Cape cooked tea cake tea drinkers, one year price appreciation of 5%.
sentences.chinese: 普茶客的熟茶饼，一年售价的升值为5%。

sentences.english: China may be allowing it to drift higher to stave off American retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 中国可能会允许它升值的更高，从而延缓美国的报复。

sentences.english: Little appreciation of space, and they were declared in numerous different.
sentences.chinese: 升值空间不大，和他们在房展会上所宣称的不一样。

sentences.english: The dollar’s recent revival will make America’s exports dearer.
sentences.chinese: 最近美元的重新升值使得美国出口商品更贵。

sentences.english: Third, the perception that RMB should be revalued.
sentences.chinese: 第三个说法是人民币该升值了。

sentences.english: Currency appreciation boosted Japan's wealth by 19% in 2016.
sentences.chinese: 2016年，货币升值使日本的财富值增长了19%。

definition: local currency/our own currency/abbr. for 本位貨幣|本位货币
